meanings.definition: The act of branching or dividing into two parts.
meanings.sent1: The furcations of the river created a beautiful pattern.
meanings.sent2: At the furcations of the road, we had to decide which way to go.
meanings.sent3: The furcations in the tree branches made it look like a natural maze.
meanings.sent4: Her decision at the furcations of life shaped her future.
meanings.sent5: The furcations in the lightning bolt were mesmerizing.

meanings.definition: A point at which something divides into two branches.
meanings.sent1: The furcations in the electrical wire were clearly visible.
meanings.sent2: The furcations of the tree trunk were strong and sturdy.
meanings.sent3: The furcations in the conversation led to a hilarious misunderstanding.
meanings.sent4: At the furcations of the story, the plot took an unexpected turn.
meanings.sent5: The furcations in the path ahead made it difficult to choose the right way.
